alert.note: Alert for Yuma (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Air Quality Alert issued April 10 at 2:11PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...AIR QUALITY HEALTH ADVISORY FOR BLOWING DUST FROM 200 PM SUNDAY UNTIL 600 PM SUNDAY... The Colorado Department of Public Health and Environment has issued the following... WHAT...Air Quality Health Advisory for Blowing Dust. WHERE...Morgan, Logan, Sedgwick, Phillips, Washington, Yuma, Elbert, and eastern parts of Weld County. Locations include, but are not limited to, Fort Morgan, Sterling, Julesburg, Holyoke, Akron, and Wray. WHEN...200 PM Sunday April 10 to 600 PM Sunday April 10 IMPACTS...Strong and gusty winds are producing areas of blowing dust Sunday afternoon. The threat for blowing dust will gradually diminish during the late afternoon hours. HEALTH INFORMATION...Public Health Recommendations: Increasing likelihood of respiratory symptoms in sensitive individuals, aggravation of heart or lung disease and premature mortality in people with cardiopulmonary disease and older adults. People with heart or lung disease, older adults, and children should reduce prolonged or heavy exertion.
